title: A Simple Guide to Resetting Your Genie Garage Door Opener

steps.title: Unplug the garage door opener for about 5 seconds.
steps.content: Unplug the garage door opener for about 5 seconds. In some cases, there may be a minor glitch in the garage door opener's circuit board. This is common after a power surge or power outage. If your garage door opener suddenly stops responding, use a ladder to reach the garage door opener. Unplug the main unit for about 5 seconds and then plug it back in. Try your garage door opener again. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press down the square button for 3-5 seconds.
steps.content: Press down the square button for 3-5 seconds. Push and hold the square “Program Set” button for at least 3 seconds. Keep holding the button until the circular LED is lit up. The oblong LED adjacent to the circular LED will then flash purple. [2] X Research source [3] X Research source If your unit doesn't have a "Program Set" button, but has a "Learn" button, press the "Learn" button instead. On most openers, you can find the buttons on the back of the unit, on the bottom of the unit facing the floor, or under the light cover. Keep in mind that the opener is the boxed device attached to your garage ceiling, while the remote refers to the smaller, pocket-sized device with 1-3 buttons.

steps.title: Select the round “Learn Code” button on some models.
steps.content: Select the round “Learn Code” button on some models. For openers made between 1995 and 2011, find the small circular LED and button labeled “Radio Signal” and “Learn Code” on older opener models. If your opener is paired with a receiver, then 1 of the buttons will indicate a radio signal of some type. Reset this style of opener by pressing and holding the “Learn Code” button until the “Radio Signal” LED begins flashing. [4] X Research source If you have a newer model, you can skip this step. If you’re uncertain about how to reset an older opener model, check Genie’s website to find the owner manual and instructional guide for your specific model: https://store.geniecompany.com/pages/shop-by-model-number .

steps.title: Push the remote button quickly.
steps.content: Push the remote button quickly. Choose one of the unlabeled rectangular buttons on your remote and press it one time. Once you’ve done this, the oblong purple LED light on the opener will light up as a solid purple and stop blinking. It doesn’t matter which button you push. Just make sure you remember the button you pressed, as this will be the button that opens and closes your garage door. [5] X Research source If your device was made between 1995 and 1997, then the remote button format will look a little different. Use the 2 curved, rectangular buttons on the top half of the remote to reset and reprogram the opener.

steps.title: Press the remote button 3 or 4 more times to reset the opener.
steps.content: Press the remote button 3 or 4 more times to reset the opener. Press the same button on your garage door remote. Wait for both the oblong and circular LED to light up blue before they switch off altogether. This calibrates the opener and syncs it with your remote control. [6] X Research source Once both LEDs switch color and turn off, push the same button on your remote to close or open your garage door. [7] X Research source At this point, the opener will be fully reset and synced with your new remote!

steps.title: Find the up/down and program keys and press them down for 5 seconds.
steps.content: Find the up/down and program keys and press them down for 5 seconds. Locate the button labeled “Program” on the top of the wireless keypad, along with the up/down button on the bottom. Press down both of these buttons simultaneously for about 5 seconds. When it has been reset successfully, the LED on the keypad will blink twice, and the entire device will go dark. [8] X Research source After you do this, any pre-existing keypad code won’t be able to open up the garage door.

steps.title: Put your garage door opener in programming mode.
steps.content: Put your garage door opener in programming mode. To do so, press and hold the "Program" button or quickly press the "Learn Code" on the garage door opener, depending on what model you have. An LED light should start flashing. You will have 30 seconds to complete the next step. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Press 3, 5, and 7 in succession after the opener is in programming mode.
steps.content: Press 3, 5, and 7 in succession after the opener is in programming mode. Push down the square “Program Set” button on the opener for at least 3 seconds to get it into programming mode. Push down the “3,” “5,” and “7” buttons in sequential order on the wireless keypad to start the programming process. This is the default PIN for all Genie garage keypads that are still using their factory settings. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Push the up/down button 3 or 4 times to open the garage door.
steps.content: Push the up/down button 3 or 4 times to open the garage door. Find the up/down button on the keypad, located toward the bottom of the device and slowly push it until the garage door opens. [11] X Research source To double-check and see if the keypad has synced correctly, input “3-5-7” into the device again and hit the up/down button. If the garage door opens or shuts, then you’re good to go! [12] X Research source

steps.title: Change the PIN.
steps.content: Change the PIN. To change the PIN, enter the current PIN (3-5-7 is the default PIN), and then press the "Program". Then enter a new PIN and press the "Program" button. The PIN can be between 3 to 8 digits long.

steps.title: Press and hold the Up and Down buttons.
steps.content: Press and hold the Up and Down buttons. If you need to reset the travel distance for any reason, you can do so by pressing and holding both the Down and Up buttons at the same time for about 10 seconds. The LED on the unit should flash there times.

steps.title: Open the door just slightly.
steps.content: Open the door just slightly. If the door is in the down position, press the Up arrow to open the door just slightly. About 2 feet should do. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Press the Down button until the door is flush with the ground.
steps.content: Press the Down button until the door is flush with the ground. Release the button when the door is in place. Make sure the door is just resting on the ground and not firmly pressed into the ground.

steps.title: Press the Set/Program button.
steps.content: Press the Set/Program button. This sets the down position for the garage door opener.

steps.title: Press the Up button until the door is fully raised.
steps.content: Press the Up button until the door is fully raised. Raise the garage door until it stops about 4 inches from the garage door opener. Be careful not to hit the head of the garage door opener.

steps.title: Press the Set/Program button.
steps.content: Press the Set/Program button. This programs the door to the up position. [14] X Research source
